title: 105_hr1008
content: LEGAL ASSISTANCE FOR FINANCIALLY NEEDY VETERANS IN CONNECTION WITH COURT OF VETERANS APPEALS PROCEEDINGS. The Court of Veterans Appeals may provide financial assistance to legal assistance entities for programs to help financially needy veterans in court proceedings. Funding may be provided through a nonprofit organization or directly to legal assistance entities if no suitable nonprofit organization is available. Financial assistance may be provided by the Court of Veterans Appeals to legal assistance entities for programs that offer free legal aid to veterans or individuals involved in court proceedings who cannot afford legal representation. Financial assistance under this program includes help with legal expenses, case screening, education for legal personnel, and promotion of pro bono services. Financial assistance under this program includes support for pro bono representation by attorneys and organizations. Legal assistance entities receiving financial aid must contribute to the program as specified. No charges or fees can be requested from individuals participating in the program. $750,000 is authorized to be appropriated to the Court annually until fiscal year 2001, with a 3 percent increase each year. Funds appropriated under this subsection may be used only for the purposes of subsection (a) and shall be provided pursuant to a written agreement. Nonprofit organizations can accept funds from the Court to provide financial assistance as grants or contracts. The Court can provide financial assistance to legal assistance entities through grants or contracts, administer the grants, and accept funds from the Court to cover administrative costs. The Court must submit an annual report to Congress on funds provided, including amounts given to nonprofit organizations. The Court can provide financial assistance to legal assistance entities and nonprofit organizations under specific subsections during the fiscal year. The Court may require these organizations to provide information on programs carried out under this section for reporting purposes. The Court can provide financial assistance to legal assistance entities and nonprofit organizations involved in providing legal assistance to those in need. Definitions for terms like nonprofit organization, legal assistance entity, and veterans service organization are provided in this section. Legal assistance for financially needy veterans in proceedings before Court.
